703398f-a.text:
Bushwick Ave., north from Scholes Street, showing the demolished N.W. corner. Upon the site of the old buildimgs, will be erected the Federal Housing Administration Apartments. From left to right aoross the clearance, are seen St. John's Evang. Lutheran Church and P.S. No. 117.
August 10, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
703398f-a.folder: Bushwick Avenue & Scholes Street, Brooklyn, NY

703399f-b.text:
(1) Bushwick Ave., north of Scholes Street, showing at the left, the new apartments being erected under the Federal Housing Administration. At the right, are the steeples of St. Catherine's Hospital.
February 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the new Federal Housing Administration sponsored
buildings which replaced old tenements.
July 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

project.

706683f-a.text:
Scholes Strect, north sidc, near the N.W. corner of Bushwick Ave. A
view of homes which are soon to be replaced by new low rental Apartment Houses,  built under the Federal Housing Act.
July S, 1935.
